children.name: The Marrow of Tradition
children.description: A fictional account of the Wilmington Insurrection of 1898 in Wilmington, North Carolina

children.name: The Sport of the Gods
children.description: A family struggles amid the harsh circumstances of life in New York City

children.name: Contending Forces
children.description: A novel that focuses on African American families in post-Civil War American society

children.name: The Autobiography of an Ex-Colored Man
children.description: Chronicles the life and struggles of a biracial man from the rural South to the Northeast and Europe

children.name: The Quest of the Silver Fleece
children.description: The novel chronicles the complex interactions between Northern financing and Southern politics

children.name: Home to Harlem
children.description: A story about a black American soldier in World War I who returns to Harlem after deseting his post in Europe

children.name: The Walls of Jericho
children.description: Humorous and satirical, the novel presents a vision that African American men can succeed in the North if they work together

children.name: Cane
children.description: Impressionistic and surrealistic sketches of Southern rural and urban life

children.name: Passing
children.description: Set primarily in the Harlem in the 1920s, the story focuses on the reunion of two childhood friends and their increasing fascination with each other's lives

children.name: Black No More
children.description: A novel about an African American scientist who invents a process that can transform blacks into whites.

children.name: Not Without Laughter
children.description: A novel that portrays African-American life in Kansas in the 1910s, focusing on the effects of class and religion on the community

children.name: Jonah's Gourd Vine
children.description: The story of a young man who loves too many women for his own good

children.name: Their Eyes Were Watching God
children.description: A novel that follows the experiences of a black girl who becomes a woman, finds love and her voice

children.name: The Street
children.description: The powerful, heartbreaking story of a young black woman struggling to raise her son amid violence, poverty, and racial realities in 1940s Harlem.

children.name: If He Hollers Let Him Go
children.description: The story of a man constantly dealing with the effects of racism.

children.name: Native Son
children.description: The story of a young black men living on Chicago's South Side in the 1930s, whose unwitting participation in horrible crime leads to considerations of systemic implications of racism and poverty.

children.name: Maud Martha
children.description: The story of a black girl who becomes a woman in 1940s Chicago

children.name: Go Tell It on The Mountain
children.description: A semi-autobiographical novel about an intelligent teenager in 1930s Harlem, and his relationship with his family and his church

name: The Outsider
description: A philosophical novel about a black man sometimes at odds with himself, raising questions about being and racism

children.name: Brown Girl, Brownstones
children.description: Portrays the inner life of a young African American woman as well as the cross-cultural conflict between black people from the US and Caribbean

children.name: Invisible Man
children.description: A novel detailing the experiences of a black man highlighting many social and intellectual challenges faced by black people in the early twentieth century

children.name: Savage Holiday
children.description: A psychological thriller about a white man who is responsible for the accidental death of his neighbor's young son

children.name: The Long Dream
children.description: In a small town in Mississippi, a prosperous black mortician's business arrangements with police and politicians unravel as his son enters adulthood.

children.name: The Man Who Cried I Am
children.description: Knowing that he is dying of cancer, a young black writer struggles to come to terms with life

children.name: Jubilee
children.description: A historical novel that focuses on the story of a biracial slave during the American Civil War

name: Babel-17
description: A science fiction novel about an interstellar war where one side develops a language that can be used as a weapon

children.name: Lawd Today!
children.description: Set in 1930s Chicago, the novel recounts a day in the life of a troubled black man who works for the post office.

children.name: Roots: The Saga of an American Family
children.description: An intergenerational story of an 18th-century African, captured, sold into slavery, and transported to North America. The story follows his life and the lives of his descendants in the United States.

children.name: Alice Walker
children.description: Story of a young black woman in the late 1960s who is attending college as she embraces the civil rights movement

name: Flight to Canada
description: A historical, political, and comedic parody a of fugitive slave narrative

name: Patternmaster
description: Heirs battle to control the minds of every being within the pattern in a tale of the struggle to attain power and understanding

children.name: The Third Life of Grange Copeland
children.description: A deeply conflicted and struggling tenant farmer in the Deep South leaves his family and everything he's ever known to live in the North only to return to confront the challenges of home and family

name: The Bluest Eye
description: A brillantly written, troubling story about the devastating consequences of neglect and racism, including a young black girl who prays for her eyes to turn blue

children.name: The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman
children.description: Story of a black woman in the South who was born into slavery in the 1850s and lives to become a part of the civil rights movement in the 1960s

name: Cotillion, Or, One Good Bull is Half the Herd
description: The story of a young black woman in Harlem who is invited to the annual cotillion thrown by high society African Americans

children.name: Corregidora
children.description: The story of a blues singer that examines womanhood, sexuality, and the psychological residue of slavery

children.name: Mumbo Jumbo
children.description: A satiric deconstruction of Western civilization that mixes portraits of historical figures and fictional characters with sound bites on subjects ranging from ragtime to Greek philosophy.

children.name: If Beale Street Could Talk
children.description: A love story set in Harlem in the early 1970s

children.name: Mind of My Mind
children.description: A young telepath has found a way to awaken - and rule - her superhuman kind, igniting a psychic battle as she challenges her creator for her right to free her people

name: Song of Solomon
description: An epic coming of age tale of a black boy who struggles to become a man and learn his complex family origins

children.name: Survivor
children.description: The story of a  group of human colonists who have fleed a plague on Earth try to adapt and make a way for themselves on an unfamiliar planet

children.name: Kindred
children.description: A mix of slave narrative and science fiction, a modern-day black woman travels back in time and must struggle with a troubling past in antebellum Maryland

children.name: Sula
children.description: The story of a young black girl who becomes a strong and determined woman and struggles with adversities of her black community

children.name: The Color Purple
children.description: Novel that charts painful experiences and eventual triumphs of a black girl and then black woman raised in rural isolation in Georgia

children.name: Oxherding Tale
children.description: The story of what results when a slave owner and his African American butler decide to switch places in each other's beds

name: The Women of Brewster Place
description: A novel that chronicles the communal strength of seven diverse black women who live in decaying rented houses on a walled-off street of an urban neighbourhood

children.name: Mama Day
children.description: The novel, which questions the notion of fixed reality, focuses on a couple in New York City

children.name: Annie John
children.description: The novel details the growth of a girl in Antigua

children.name: Wild Seed
children.description: Story of a centuries-old, shape-shifting, healer woman who struggles against another immortal who wants her to assist him in creating a world in his image.

name: The Salt Eaters
description: A community of Black faith healers witness an event that will change their lives forever

children.name: Clay's Ark
children.description: Set in a near-future dystopia, the novel traces the experiences of a physician living in Southern California, and his sixteen-year-old twin daughters.

children.name: Dessa Rose
children.description: A neo-slave narrative about a pregnant fugitive slave

children.name: Mama
children.description: A novel about the struggles of a mother with five children

name: Beloved
description: The story of a family of formerly enslaved people whose home is haunted by a ghost

children.name: Tar Baby
children.description: A novel that portrays a love affair between two Black Americans from very different worlds

children.name: Blanche Among the Talented Tenth
children.description: The story of a black woman accidental detective who is encouraged to use her considerable skills to solve a murder mystery.

children.name: Breath, Eyes, Memory
children.description: Novel about a young girl's coming of age under difficult circumstance

children.name: Blanche Cleans Up
children.description: The story of a black woman accidental detective who uncovers political corruption, environmental contamination, and dark secrets

name: The Farming of Bones
description: The story of an orphaned young Haitian woman living in the Dominican Republic who gets caught up in the carnage of the Parsley massacre during the dictatorship of Rafael Trujillo

name: Brown Girl in the Ring
description: The science fiction saga of a young woman wh must open herself to ancient truths, eternal powers, and the tragic mystery surrounding her mother and grandmother

children.name: Middle Passage
children.description: A novel focusing on the journey of a freed slave who, seeking to flee debtors and an unwanted impending marriage, sneaks onto a slave ship.

name: Devil in a Blue Dress
description: A novel about a black man who transforms from a day laborer into a detective as he seeks to solve a case

children.name: The Intuitionist
children.description: A partial detective novel, focusing on rival factions of elevator inspectors, that presents an expansive investigation of social progress and racial struggle.

name: The Coldest Winter Ever
description: The novel chronicles the experiences of a young black woman, the daughter of a drug dealer, who decides to make a name for herself after her family falls on hard times

children.name: A Lesson Before Dying
children.description: Set in Louisiana in the late 1940s, a twenty-one-year-old uneducated black field worker is wrongfully accused, convicted, and sentenced to death.

children.name: The White Boy Shuffle
children.description: A comical novel about a reluctant black boy hero

name: HowvStella Got Her Groove Back
description: A love story about a woman who transforms from a materialistic business analyst to confident, more fulfilled person

children.name: Waiting to Exhale
children.description: A novel about a group of black women friends who get together frequently to support one another and listen to each other vent about life and love.

name: Jazz
description: Set primarily in Harlem, a story about black history and culture, a love traingle

children.name: Paradise
children.description: A novel about the downfall of a perceived utopia

children.name: Purple Hibiscus
children.description: Set in postcolonial Nigeria, the novel tells the story of a teenager who struggles to mature and charts the disintegration of her family

children.name: The Known World
children.description: Novel about the life and death of Henry Townsend, a free black man who was once a slave and became a slave owner

name: Getting Mother's Body
description: A multi-perspective novel primarily about a black teenager who is pregnant by a married man and the travels she a group make from Texas to Arizona

name: Love
description: The story of a black man and the women who love him, fight over him, make him miserable, and finally drive him to his grave.

children.name: John Henry Days
children.description: A novel, comprised of several multiple threads, about a modern-day black press journalist interspered with accounts related to the legendary John Henry

children.name: Apex Hides the Hurt
children.description: The story of an unnamed nomenclature consultant who is asked to bring his talent for naming to a southern town seeking to rebrand itself

children.name: Sag Harbor
children.description: A coming of age story set in the summer 1985 about black boys who live in beach houses

children.name: Fledging
children.description: A science fiction vampire novel

children.name: Leaving Atlanta
children.description: A fictional account of the Atlanta Child Murders presented from the perspectives of three children

children.name: A Mercy
children.description: Set in colonial America in the late 17th century, the story of a European farmer, his purchased wife, and his growing household of indentured or enslaved white, Native American, and African characters

children.name: White Teeth
children.description: A novel focusing on the later lives of two wartime friends one Bangladeshi and one English and their families in London.

children.name: The Twelve Tribes of Hattie
children.description: A novel about the matriarch of a black family of the Great Migration and her children and grandchildren

children.name: Home
children.description: A story about an African-American veteran traumatised by his experiences in the Korean war

children.name: Americanah
children.description: The story of a young Nigerian woman who immigrates to the United States to attend university

children.name: Zone One
children.description: A dystopian novel primarily set in New York City, after the Earth has fought against zombies

name: Salvage the Bones
description: A story that focuses on the plight of a working-class African-American family in Mississippi as they prepare for Hurricane Katrina

children.name: The Underground Railroad
children.description: An expansive account of a young black woman who was born enslaved and struggles to attain her freedom

name: Another Brooklyn
description: A novel about a woman recounting her youth and teenage years growing up in the city

children.name: The Nickel Boys
children.description: A fictional account focusing on black boy experiences at a notorious reform school in Flordia

name: The Water Dancer
description: A novel about a former slave with special powers who seeks to free others

children.name: Washington Black
children.description: A novel about a boy who rises from slavery to become a free man

children.name: Sing, Unburied, Sing
children.description: A novel about a troubled black woman on a road trip with her two children  as they bring the children's white father home from prison

name: Swing Time
description: Set in Northwest London in the 1970s and '80s, a story of a woman, the child of a black mother and a white father, raised in public-housing estates.

children.name: A Brief History of Seven Killings
children.description: Fictional account concerning the failed assassination of Bob Marley

children.name: The Sellout
children.description: A comedic and fascinating novel set in and around Los Angeles, California, focusing on racial relations in the United States

name: God Help the Child
description: The story of a young black woman who has had to overcome many obstacles in her life from her childhood to becoming a successful business woman

children.name: The Vanishing Half
children.description: A story that follows the lives of two twin girls, both light-skinned Black girls, who run away from home at the age of sixteen

children.name: Harlem Shuffle
children.description: A crime novel about a furniture salesman struggling to make ends meet

name: The Man Who Lived Underground
description: The story of a black man falsely accused of a crime who is thus forced to flee underground
